name: Brandy Moore House
description: Rafiki’s Brandy Moore House (BMH) is a supportive housing program that provides transitional and case management services for very low-income African Americans who are HIV-positive/AIDS diagnosed, sober from substance use/abuse and are homeless as defined by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban development (HUD). BMH participants are provided with housing, wellness services, and case management in a communal residential experience for six months at a time with an option for another six-month
